programme.title: The Cinema List: The 90s
programme.desc: Alex Zane and celebrity film fans go back to the 90s to celebrate some of the decade's greatest films, from classic comedies to epic blockbusters.

programme.title: Gorillas in the Mist
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Sigourney Weaver. Dian Fossey arrives in central Africa full of high ideals and a passion for nature, determined to research rare mountain gorillas faced with extinction. Over the coming years she builds a strong bond with the powerful animals, but tragedy is never far away.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Swords And Sandals
programme.desc: Combining epic action set pieces and intense narratives, the Cinema List explores the genre of sword and sandal movies. Check out 300, Conan the Barbarian and more.

programme.title: The Prince of Egypt
programme.desc: Animated retelling of the story of Moses, featuring the voices of Val Kilmer and Ralph Fiennes. Rescued by the Queen of Egypt from a reed basket floating on the river Nile, baby Moses is raised as the brother of Rameses, heir to the throne. Years later, when Moses discovers he is really the child of Hebrew slaves, he sets about freeing his people.

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: Comedy starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito and Emma Thompson. A research scientist loses funding for his work on a fertility drug. Desperate to prove that his treatment works, he steals some frozen human eggs and mixes them with a colleague's sperm, with astonishing results.

programme.title: Matilda
programme.desc: Comic fantasy based on the book by Roald Dahl, starring Mara Wilson and Danny DeVito. Matilda, the daughter of Harry and Zinnia Wormwood, has adored reading from a precociously early age, but her parents refuse to let her go to school. Until, that is, her father sends her to the unforgiving Miss Trunchbull's Crunchem Hall, where she discovers that she has other more useful gifts.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical starring Catherine Zeta-Jones, RenÃ©e Zellweger and Richard Gere. In 1920s Chicago, chorus girl Roxie Hart shoots her lover and winds up in jail, believing her dreams of stardom are over. Enter hotshot lawyer Billy Flynn, whose clients include double murderess Velma Kelly, and Roxie begins to realise that there's no such thing as bad publicity.

programme.title: Singin' in the Rain
programme.desc: Classic musical comedy starring Gene Kelly, Debbie Reynolds and Donald O'Connor. Silent film stars Don Lockwood and Lina Lamont are the golden couple of 1920s Hollywood. However, when "talkies" become all the rage, prima donna Lina is shown up by the new technology and aspiring actress Kathy Selden is called in to dub her voice.

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: Romantic drama, starring Robert Redford and Mia Farrow, set in the Roaring Twenties against a background of hot jazz, Prohibition and wild parties. A mysterious young millionaire with bootlegging connections becomes involved in Long Island high society. His lavish social gatherings are held to lure his long-lost love away from her cruel but extremely wealthy husband.

programme.title: The Cinema List: The 90s
programme.desc: Alex Zane and celebrity film fans go back to the 90s to celebrate some of the decade's greatest films, from classic comedies to epic blockbusters.

programme.title: Gorillas in the Mist
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Sigourney Weaver. Dian Fossey arrives in central Africa full of high ideals and a passion for nature, determined to research rare mountain gorillas faced with extinction. Over the coming years she builds a strong bond with the powerful animals, but tragedy is never far away.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Swords And Sandals
programme.desc: Combining epic action set pieces and intense narratives, the Cinema List explores the genre of sword and sandal movies. Check out 300, Conan the Barbarian and more.

programme.title: The Prince of Egypt
programme.desc: Animated retelling of the story of Moses, featuring the voices of Val Kilmer and Ralph Fiennes. Rescued by the Queen of Egypt from a reed basket floating on the river Nile, baby Moses is raised as the brother of Rameses, heir to the throne. Years later, when Moses discovers he is really the child of Hebrew slaves, he sets about freeing his people.

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: Comedy starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito and Emma Thompson. A research scientist loses funding for his work on a fertility drug. Desperate to prove that his treatment works, he steals some frozen human eggs and mixes them with a colleague's sperm, with astonishing results.

programme.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street

programme.title: On Becoming a Guinea Fowl

programme.title: Tuesday
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter must confront Death when it arrives in the form of an astonishing talking bird.

programme.title: Waitress: The Musical

programme.title: Mr. Popper's Penguins

programme.title: The Day the Earth Blew Up: A Looney Tunes Movie
programme.desc: Porky Pig and Daffy Duck become Earth's only hope when their antics at the local bubble-gum factory uncover a secret alien mind-control plot. Faced with cosmic odds, they must save their town and the world while not driving each other totally looney.

programme.title: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
programme.desc: Godzilla and the almighty Kong face a colossal threat hidden deep within the planet, challenging their very existence and the survival of the human race.

programme.title: Supergirl

programme.title: Green Lantern
programme.desc: The Green Lanterns have little regard for humans, who have been unable to harness the powers of the ring each member wears. But Jordan, a test pilot, may be the corps' only hope when an enemy called Parallax threatens the universal balance of power.

programme.title: Batman

programme.title: Jane Fonda in Five Acts

programme.title: Citizen U.S.A.: A 50-State Road Trip

programme.title: Superman II

programme.title: Elevation
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic survivors find refuge in the Rocky Mountains to hide from giant, insect-like creatures that can't live above 8,000 feet. However, when one of them needs life-saving supplies, they risk it all to venture into the danger zone.

programme.title: A Different Man
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Edward undergoes a radical medical procedure to drastically transform his appearance. But his new dream face turns into a nightmare as he becomes obsessed with reclaiming what he lost.

programme.title: Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga
programme.desc: Young Furiosa gets caught in the crossfire of two tyrannical warlords. As the tyrants fight for dominance, Furiosa soon finds herself in a nonstop battle to make her way home.

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder and determined to save others from the same fate, Dr. Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. While at first it seems to be a radical success, a darkness inside of him is soon unleashed.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: While Lex Luthor plots against him, the Man of Steel tries to reconnect with Lois Lane and find his place in a world that learned to survive in his absence.

programme.title: Knox Goes Away
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a rapidly evolving form of dementia, a contract killer gets the chance to redeem himself by saving the life of his estranged son.

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Teens meet with horrible ends after a classmate's (Devon Sawa) precognitive vision leads to their ejection from a doomed airliner.

programme.title: Final Destination 2
programme.desc: Death returns to claim the lives of those who did not die in a horrible highway calamity as they were meant to do.

programme.title: Aquaman
programme.desc: Aquaman must retrieve the legendary Trident of Atlan to save the underwater city of Atlantis -- and the surface world -- from his power-hungry brother.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Black Manta wields the power of the mythic Black Trident to unleash an ancient and malevolent force. Hoping to end his reign of terror, Aquaman forges an unlikely alliance with his brother to protect their kingdom and save the world from destruction.

programme.title: Public Enemies
programme.desc: Depression-era outlaw John Dillinger (Johnny Depp) becomes the fledgling FBI's most-wanted criminal and a folk hero to much of America's downtrodden public.

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: A young photographer uncovers a dark secret when he meets his girlfriend's seemingly friendly parents for the first time at their posh estate.

programme.title: Opus
programme.desc: A journalist is invited to the remote compound of a legendary pop star who mysteriously disappeared 30 years ago. Surrounded by the star's cult of sycophants, she gets caught in the middle of his twisted plan.

programme.title: Companion
programme.desc: A weekend getaway at a remote cabin turns to chaos when it's revealed that one of the guests -- a subservient android built for human companionship -- has gone haywire.

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: A dramatization of the disaster in April 2010, when the offshore drilling rig called the Deepwater Horizon exploded, resulting in the worst oil spill in American history.

programme.title: A French Forger
programme.desc: Artist and forger Guy Ribes shares the secrets behind the creation of his art.

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: Scientists at a remote, top-secret facility find themselves in a dangerous lockdown with an unpredictable and violent bioengineered child (Anya Taylor-Joy).

programme.title: The Bank Job
programme.desc: In 1971 London, a car dealer (Jason Statham) and his gang of thieves break into a bank vault and find far more than cash and jewelry.

programme.title: Parasite
programme.desc: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

programme.title: Janet Planet
programme.desc: Enthralled by her own imagination, 11-year-old Lacy spends the long summer at home with her mother and three strangers.

programme.desc: When a vengeful trio of ancient gods arrives on Earth in search of the magic stolen from them long ago, Shazam and his allies get thrust into a battle for their superpowers, their lives, and the fate of the world.
